alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Randolph; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 10:53AM CDT until April 05 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Randolph County in eastern Arkansas... Lawrence County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Sharp County in north central Arkansas... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1052 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Black Rock, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pocahontas... Walnut Ridge... Hoxie... Black Rock... Lake Charles State Park... Imboden... Ravenden... Reyno... College City... Portia... Maynard... Biggers... Lynn... O`Kean... Annieville... Attica... Smithville... Powhatan... Whiskerville... Giles Spur... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for eastern and north central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for eastern and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Little Rock. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for eastern and north central Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for eastern and north central Arkansas.
